N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5302.5 - Regulatory investigative fees and costs

State Regulations
(a) Pursuant to Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering
and Breeding Law section 1349, a gaming facility licensee shall pay for the
costs of any investigation into a violation of article 13 of the Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law or regulation promulgated caused by such
licensee. The costs of an investigation conducted pursuant to this section
shall be assessed directly to such licensee upon completion of an
investigation. (b) Billable hours
by commission staff shall be determined by using payroll costs for commission
employees as obtained from the office of the State comptroller, including
salaries and non-wage compensation and payroll taxes, as well as fringe benefit
and indirect costs at rates established by the division of the
budget. (c) The commission shall
charge the gaming facility licensee for actual costs of any consultant
including, without limitation, attorneys, accountants, investigators and other
designees of the commission related to such consultation. Notes
